subject: Politics
title: Tax Havens
description: A quick win: understand Tax Havens.

hook.text: Apple routed profits through Ireland and paid almost no tax. Legally. Tax havens rob nations of billions.

buildup.text: Tax havens offer near-zero tax rates to attract corporate money. Profits shift; taxes vanish.

discovery.text: An estimated $10 trillion sits in offshore accounts. That's more than the GDP of Japan and Germany combined.

twist.text: Tax havens include respected places: Ireland, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, and the US state of Delaware.

climax.text: A global minimum tax of 15% was agreed in 2021. It's a start, but enforcement remains the hard part.

punchline.text: Tax havens are legal robbery. The rules protect those who wrote them.

quiz.question: How much wealth is estimated to be held in offshore accounts?
